award_title: Targeted Infusing Project: Integrating Chemistry Research with Analytical and Forensic Chemistry Education to Enhance Undergraduate Research, Pedagogy, and Workforce Development
subject: methods that outlive the paper
body:
Hi Kesete,

Building out CUREs for analytical and forensic chemistry—that's a lot of method development that ideally students could actually build on, not just read about in a lab manual.

I've been working on something called Ouro after running into this problem myself. Ouro is a way to make computational work discoverable, reusable, and citable—so methods live on as infrastructure, not just text in a methods section.

Figured it might be relevant given the trace analysis and forensic method development you're doing. The gap between "we published this" and "someone can actually use it" is real.

Happy to give you a quick peek if it's useful.

Hope winter break treats you well—happy holidays.

Cheers,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
